page.title: 10EDUCATION IN WHEATHAMPSTEAD
page.content: Their school uniform colour is blue and grey.The boys wear grey trousers or shorts and a blue sweat shirt.The girls wear grey skirts and a blue sweat shirt but sometimes the girls wear blue checked sun dresses in the summer.The school is the same size as Beech Hyde school and so is the field.The church is named after St.Helens school which is in the village.The headmaster is called Mr Warner.We don't know what the rest of the staff are called.The symbol of the school is a stag.It was built a hundred years ago.It's the oldest school in Wheathampstead.St.Helens school was founded in 1815 and it was replaced in 1969.When the children leave they go onto Wheathampstead School which is a senior school.
